Hint1: Think about how the weights on Planet A and Planet B change at the same rate together. Because this is a proportional relationship, the unit rate, or quotient, stays constant. How many times more do objects weigh on Planet A compared to their weight on Planet B, and how can you express that mathematically?

We can observe how the weights on Planet A and Planet B vary together. You understand that this is a proportional relationship, indicating that the unit rate (quotient) stays the same. Figure out how many times the weight on Planet A is compared to the weight on Planet B, and revise the equation.
